parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
